issue.title: Properly check whether columns are counter cache in order to display them or not

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
Check the column is actually a counter cache column. Fixes #7346

<!--

Thanks for contributing to ActiveAdmin!

You can find all the instructions for contributing at the [CONTRIBUTING file].

Before submitting your PR make sure that:

* You wrote [good commit messages].
* The PR relates to *only* one subject with a clear title and description in grammatically correct, complete sentences.
* The PR description [includes keywords to automatically close issues] if it fixes an existing issue.
* Your feature branch is up-to-date with `master` (if not - rebase it), and does not include merge commits.
* Related commits are squashed together, and unrelated commits are splitted apart.
* Your PR includes a regression test if it fixes a bug.

Before expecting a review for your PR make sure that all github checks are passing, but feel free to ask for early feedback if you need guidance.

[CONTRIBUTING file]: https://github.com/activeadmin/activeadmin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
[good commit messages]: https://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/
[includes keywords to automatically close issues]: https://help.github.com/en/articles/closing-issues-using-keywords

-->

body: Thank you for submitting a PR for this. We'll update it and take it from there.

I just ran into this issue and was very confused why my column was not showing up. Can this issue be re-opened? It's definitely not fixed yet, and the mentioned PR has seen no movement for more than a year.

@pdfrod no sorry, we don't reopen an issue if we have acknowledged that we will accept a PR. Fixing this or documenting a workaround will be dependent on your or the community's contribution. I have left comments on that PR and they haven't been addressed. You are more than welcome to open a new PR. Thank you.
Thanks for the explanation @javierjulio. I'll see if I can get a new PR to address the issue.

issue.title: Better implementation of counter-cache-column check

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
Reimplementation of https://github.com/activeadmin/activeadmin/pull/7347.
Fixes https://github.com/activeadmin/activeadmin/issues/7346.

Thanks @plashchynski for the work!

Original Issue:
```
I have a model with some column ends with a "_count" substring.
This column doesn't appear on a show page.
It should appear as It is a regular column just like any other.
```

issue.title: Backport Better implementation of counter-cache-column check

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.
